p: Hamedani, Haghani, and Kelishadi ( 2020) referred that considers continuing education, especially among students, is the best way to modify their life style, and controlling and improving factors affecting lifestyle make school education more effective, especially in times of epidemics. As same, in a study conducted by Noormah and Jainatul ( 2017), the results indicated that all teachers in the study preferred to use teaching‐centered teaching strategies, and few made an effort to integrate student‐centered teaching strategies in their lessons. The results also revealed that students were more involved in lessons that provided an offer to learn with experience and collaborative learning. The findings of this study benefit teachers, researchers, policy makers, to decision‐making process in the epidemiological situations.
